topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b54f1363687235986b0f00#post_54b54f1363687235986b0f00
[bq="Too_Offensive"]"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b54dfe636872352b410600#post_54b54dfe636872352b410600
Heat death of the universe is an asshole[/bq]
Not really; without entropy nothing could exist.

Getting a bit poetic here but personally I think both destruction and creation are equally beautiful and necessary.  If entropy didn't exist then the big bang couldn't have happened therefore life could have never happened.  If we were to reverse entropy then the universe would reverse it's direction eventually ending with a big crunch and the universe reverting to it's original state of being a singular point.  If we were to change the universe where to dark matter and gravity were equal, basically negating entropy, then life couldn't exist either.  Getting really poetic here but it's like the concept of yin and yang; two opposing forces that on the surface seem to be incompatible but as a whole are part of a larger balance.  Without entropy life couldn't exist; without gravity and such the universe would instantly die.

topics.body:
I just got a new favourite speech

"A few weeks ago, I was happily retired, sulking by my swimming pool, and my psychotic best friend shows up out of nowhere to torture me over mistakes, +honest mistakes+, that I made _over a decade ago!_ We? Our little posse? Are fucking broke, but hey, let's go out and spend two million dollars on a tandem-rotor fuckin' chopper so I can steal nerve gas from fucking _terrorists!_ Forgive me, _you *ignorant fuck!*_ But sarcasm is all I fucking got! Sarcasm, and a room full of *_you cunts!"_*
